Enteric fever is a potentially life-threatening infection that requires early diagnosis and management. It is seen particularly in VFR travelers returning from Asia,
3 although there have been outbreaks in Malawi and Kenya, and this may translate into more imported cases.
10 With an incubation period of 7 to 18 days (range up to 60 days), most patients present within a month of return. A history of vaccination pre-travel has little predictive value; it provides incomplete protection against S. Typhi and no protection against S. Paratyphi.
